newsitem.title: SPAIN: Policeman wounded in Spains Basque country.
newsitem.headline: Policeman wounded in Spains Basque country.

text.p: A policeman was wounded by a petrol bomb on Sunday in clashes in Spains Basque country, government sources said.
Media reports said the policeman suffered second and third degree burns on his face and hands in a confrontation with masked youths in Hernari in the province of Guipuzcoa.
It was the most serious incident in a weekend of violence in the Basque region where youths who support the separatist group ETA frequently stage street demonstrations.
Basque country police intervened on Sunday evening when demonstrators tried to burn a telephone booth and trash cans, erected barricades and threw petrol bombs at banks.
The youths responded by throwing the petrol bombs and other objects at police.
In other incidents over the weekend in the same area, several vehicles were burned and a train station office and automatic bank teller were damaged by petrol bombs.
